content:
penn State students and a State College resident joined at the Allen Streets gates to protest a bill that would remove state funds from sanctuary campuses PERIOD

House bill  was introduced on Jan PERIOD  by the General Assembly of Pennsylvania PERIOD

According to the bill an institution or higher education shall not be eligible for funding through a State appropriation if it prohibits an immigration federal law or commonwealth law refuses access to by federal authorities to a campus directs employees to not communicate with federal authorities or applies an adverse employment action to employees that comply with federal authorities PERIOD

Although Penn State does not label itself as a sanctuary campus Fanta Conde said the students were standing in solidarity with other Pennsylvania universities who will be affected by the bill PERIOD Nine universities in the state were also protesting the bill today PERIOD

I think we should just say we are a sanctuary campus because I think as a big university that has a lot of foreign students its really important to protect both the noncitizens that came here legally and any who are here illegally Kathryn Van Develde seniormeteorology said PERIOD

Conde juniorpolitical science and philosophy said that she along with the other organizers were approached this week by the Pennsylvania Student Power Network to create the event PERIOD

The protest which was posted on Facebook last night garnered six students PERIOD Conde said the organizers would create another event after spring break PERIOD
